channel.title: Klaytn - CCO Onboarding - Baobab on Klaytn CCO Onboarding - Baobab
channel.description: Recent content in Klaytn - CCO Onboarding - Baobab on Klaytn CCO Onboarding - Baobab

item.title: Firewall Configuration
item.description: 1. (Only for CN) Firewall configuration 1) If pre-cypress performance test is completed, remove below Klaytn CN’s IP address of Pre-cypress from your firewall ingress rule. 18.182.114.118 2) For communication and multichannel between Baobab CN, allow TCP 32323-32324 with below IP addresses to your firewall ingress rule. 54.180.180.202 54.180.18.176 52.79.134.72 52.78.232.39 3) Additionally, it is required to allow UDP 32323 with the same IP addresses to your firewall ingress rule.

item.title: Start the klaytn services
item.description: 1. Start the Klaytn service, if it is running. 1) For CN, $ sudo systemctl status kcnd $ sudo systemctl start kcnd $ sudo systemctl status kcnd 2) For PN, $ sudo systemctl status kpnd $ sudo systemctl start kpnd $ sudo systemctl status kpnd 3) If the services are not installed from Yum, you can start the service like below, $ sudo <installation_path>/kcnd status $ sudo <installation_path>/kcnd start $ sudo <installation_path>/kcnd status If you finish this step, please click the next button > on the right side of this page.

item.title: Prepare genesis.json for Baobab network
item.description: 1. Remove or backup existing genesis.json for Pre-cypress. 1) For CN, $ mv <your_klaytn_home_path>/kcnd/data/genesis.json <your_klaytn_home_path>/kcnd/data/genesis.json.pre-cypress 2) For PN, $ mv <your_klaytn_home_path>/kpnd/data/genesis.json <your_klaytn_home_path>/kpnd/data/genesis.json.pre-cypress 2. Download the genesis.json for Baobab network. 1) For CN, $ curl -X GET https://packages.klaytn.net/baobab/genesis.json -o <your_klaytn_home_path>/kcnd/data/genesis.json 2) For PN, $ curl -X GET https://packages.klaytn.net/baobab/genesis.json -o <your_klaytn_home_path>/kpnd/data/genesis.json 3. Check the network_id in the genesis.json downloaded. 1) For CN, $ grep "chainId" <your_klaytn_home_path>/kcnd/data/genesis.json "chainId": 1001, 2) For PN, $ grep "chainId" <your_klaytn_home_path>/kpnd/data/genesis.

item.title: Download the latest Baobab chaindata
item.description: 1. Download the latest chaindata snapshot from the Baobab snapshot archive. 0) Before proceeding, please check if your disk space is enough to store and extract the Baobab chaindata. ** You can refer to the Boabab snapshot archive where the Baobab chaindata snapshots have been snapshotted. 1) Download the latest one from the archive. ** Please note that this step will take a long time to download since snapshot is more than 100 GB.

item.title: Stop the Klaytn service
item.description: 1. Stop the Klaytn service, if it is running. 1) For CN, $ sudo systemctl status kcnd $ sudo systemctl stop kcnd $ sudo systemctl status kcnd 2) For PN, $ sudo systemctl status kpnd $ sudo systemctl stop kpnd $ sudo systemctl status kpnd 3) If the services are not installed from Yum, you can stop the service like below, $ sudo <installation_path>/kcnd status $ sudo <installation_path>/kcnd stop $ sudo <installation_path>/kcnd status If you finish this step, please click the next button > on the right side of this page.

item.title: Package Installation
item.description: 2. Installation of Klaytn packages for CN and PN ** We’ve already installed packages during the Pre-cypress stage. If you need to install newly, please refer these documents. 1) CN - https://docs.klaytn.foundation/node/core-cell/installation-guide/consensus-node-setup/installation-guide 2) PN - https://docs.klaytn.foundation/node/core-cell/installation-guide/proxy-node-setup/installation-guide If you finish this step, please click the next button > on the right side of this page.

item.title: Start the Telegraf service
item.description: 2. Start the Telegraf service, if it is running. 1) For both CN and PN, $ sudo systemctl status telegraf $ sudo systemctl start telegraf $ sudo systemctl status telegraf If you finish this step, please click the next button > on the right side of this page.

item.title: Node Configuration
item.description: 1. Modify network, discovery and boot node information. ** Note that CN and PN have some different information. 1) For CN, $ egrep "^NETWORK|NO_DISCOVER|BOOTNODES" /etc/kcnd/conf/kcnd.conf NETWORK="baobab" NETWORK_ID= NO_DISCOVER=0 # setting 1 to disable discovery BOOTNODES="kni://8e1881cdca97f52a76c6d2683db030f51a34ffc039476b4ed5bc5c757de1b5ce48fea1e53aa182a6ac2b076460881d50d3b57461d1cf36fae777e992893ad485@52.199.8.244:32323?discport=32323&ntype=bn" 2) For PN, $ egrep "^NETWORK|NO_DISCOVER|BOOTNODES" /etc/kpnd/conf/kpnd.conf NETWORK="baobab" NETWORK_ID= NO_DISCOVER=1 # setting 1 to disable discovery BOOTNODES="" 2. Check if the static-nodes.json is correct for your PN. ** Unlike CN, PN uses a static-nodes.json file to find out where to connect.

item.title: Extract the chaindata
item.description: 1. Extract the chaindata downloaded to the DATA_DIR. 1) For CN, $ grep "DATA_DIR" /etc/kcnd/conf/kcnd.out $ tar -C <your_klaytn_home_path>/kcnd/data -xvf klaytn-baobab-chaindata-latest.tar.gz ** If you don’t remember the path DATA_DIR, you can check kcnd.conf. 2) For PN, $ grep "DATA_DIR" /etc/kpnd/conf/kpnd.out $ tar -C <your_klaytn_home_path>/kpnd/data -xvf klaytn-baobab-chaindata-latest.tar.gz ** If you don’t remember the path DATA_DIR, you can check kpnd.conf. 2. You can remove the chaindata downloaded, if the previous step is completed.

item.title: Stop the Telegraf service
item.description: 2. Stop the Telegraf service, if it is running. 1) For both CN and PN, $ sudo systemctl status telegraf $ sudo systemctl stop telegraf $ sudo systemctl status telegraf If you finish this step, please click the next button > on the right side of this page.

item.title: Check the monitoring dashboard
item.description: 3. Take a look at Grafana dashboard to confirm if your nodes are correctly joined to Baobab network. Link : Baobab Grafana Everything is completed, if your nodes are shown in this dashboard. please send a message to Klaytn DevOps by Slack. If you finish this step, please click the next button > on the right side of this page.

item.title: Node Initialization
item.description: 1. Now, we will initialize each node using the Baobab genesis file. 1) For CN, $ cd <your_klaytn_home_path>/kcnd/data $ kcn --networkid 1001 init --datadir <your_klaytn_home_path>/kcnd/data genesis.json 2) For PN, $ cd <your_klaytn_home_path>/kcnd/data $ kcn --networkid 1001 init --datadir <your_klaytn_home_path>/kpnd/data genesis.json If you finish this step, please click the next button > on the right side of this page.

item.title: Remove chaindata and log
item.description: 3. Remove existing chaindata and log for pre-cypress. 1) For CN, $ sudo rm -Rf <your_klaytn_home_path>/kcnd/data/klay/chaindata $ sudo rm -Rf <your_klaytn_home_path>/kcnd/data/klay/lightchaindata $ sudo rm -Rf <your_klaytn_home_path>/kcnd/log/* 2) For PN, $ sudo rm -Rf <your_klaytn_home_path>/kpnd/data/klay/chaindata $ sudo rm -Rf <your_klaytn_home_path>/kpnd/data/klay/lightchaindata $ sudo rm -Rf <your_klaytn_home_path>/kpnd/log/* If you finish this step, please click the next button > on the right side of this page.
